title: Mia Chloe
author: Mia Chloe
content: Original Topic: Why beginners should pay attention to their privacyAuthor: o_e_l_e_oI nor de eva normally tel people make Dem watch videos, but dis one worth d 30 minutes even if I nor sti like him style: Data Brokers: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver (HBO)The whole matter sef de fear pesin. Everybody no (or suppose no )say many browsers, websites, and apps de  monitor you and Dem de  collect ur data. Watin many people no no b say data brokers de buy and sell Every single one way Dem collect  from u. dis data fit b money way u de owe or how your body take de and Dem fit sell am give  anybody way want am.One broker way dem de  call Epsilon settle 4 $150 million after Dem don sell data tire  give  people way Dem no say b scammers for over 10 years. Dem don sell Data give domestic abusers and stalkers(people way de monitor) way go  allow dem track  old victims.D video talk one case way pesin die bcos of him data way Dem sell for money way no reach $50.Many  companies talk say ur data de hidden, de-identified, or Dem de added  with other data before dem share am or sell am, and many pipo think say Dem de safe.dem find out from One study say 99.98% of all dis  anonymized data Dem fit  de-anonymized am  and Dem fit use am identify users. To de Anonymize  data no get meaning.common website way we fit visit(without say we no even do anything for d website) go still give the website enough information to take identify the user, track their contact information, con sti send am email after some minutes.Dem de  sell your data give government. Governments fit need  warrant or other legal ruling to fit come search your computer or device, but Dem nor need any permission to take buy that information from data brokers. Many government agency de buy ur data and dem de use am  for anything way Dem want.dis matter ressemble matter of dis agency Dem de use data analysis from many blockchain company tay track ur Bitcoin transaction and ur Bitcoin address.To add join am, centralized exchanges de  provide many type of data give data brokers, especially if you by urself  give Dem ur KYC information d same tin with  blockchain explorers d same tin with  SPV and light wallet servers.d same tin wit sites like Coinmarketcap or other  crypto news site. All dis Bitcoin information and other information way relate to crypto Dem go pool am join other of ur info way Dem get con sell am give  anybody way want am,even Dem  scammers and criminals. Remember say na simple click of website give d website info way go reach no d pesin way click am.you really wan make d whole world know how many bitcoin you de hodl?D way Dem tay de cast our privacy and watin we de do day by day too much. So no make am worse by say u con de cast ur privacy matter by ursef.Dis one na better place to take start to de take back ur control well well: https://www.privacyguides.org/Peer to peer bitcoin trades, avoid d privacy invasion of centralized exchanges: https://bisq.network/, https://localcryptos.com/, https://hodlhodl.com/Run your own node, and avoid to de leak information about your address and transactions: https://bitcoin.org/en/bitcoin-core/

comments.body: Just the knowledge say person de the other end of the apps and site we de use go point you to the fact say your privacy no de guaranteed at all. Even WhatsApp when de take this end to end encryption mater for there head fit still de sell our data out. And the hard reality be say the majority of our private lives and conversations de our device and a huge number of persons out there no even know how to take protect there privacy from being bridged by an intruder. But what do you expect from person after entrusting your documents on their care, they all gladly cooperate with government when they request for your details, they will surely comply because they don't want to be out of the business.The best place your privacy can be protected is within you, nobody will keep you safe. Giving your documents just to use a service is not right, using their service one day can lead you to what you don't expect as they can even impound your coins and do what they wish because you accepted their terms and conditions before you registered on the exchange.Your privacy doesn't end with centralized, it goes beyond that. Be careful of the browsers you use especially one like chrome, I don't have a single trust with Google products because they love to personalize users data and do anything they want with it. Use VPN if necessary.

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: Nice translation Mia Chloe. Privacy na one matter wey we suppose dey take very seriously when we dey surf for internet. Corporations like Google, Facebook, Twitter etc dey collect our data from our devices like name, sex, age, location, ip address, browser history, purchase activity, come sell am to whoever get deep pocket. Another way dem dey take steal our data na through KYC, it's either the exchange go sell the information or the agency wey dem contract to sell am Sometimes this data fit go end up for dark web, so imagine the harm wey e fit do to you if bad actor get hold of your data. Like this, make we dey careful, make we dey use VPN, TOR and make we dey avoid KYC.

comments.author: DubemIfedigbo001
comments.body: Thanks for the head's up man, you really threw much light on wetin dey very obvious. Some people still dey trust sites wey dey promise them say them no dey correct their data e.g emails, activities of interest, phone number, DOB,etc. For E-commerce sites or any site that you make purchases on they get your card details, address, occupation, e.t.c. All These information dey at the risk to enter wrong hands daily, especially if na companies wey  no get proper legal indictment with their ICT staffs dey handle am.Most companies dey save your data, even when them give you opportunity make you dictate their involvement, they dey go against your negative permission take accumulate your data and possibly distribute am give scammers around for money settlements. I dey work for ICT units, so I dey see clearly how user data  dey exposed and left at the mercy of the companies.I  dey discourage to put your card details to make payments of any kind, you fit opt for transfers make you fit secure your bank details at least, spyware and Trojans fit dey there to steal your data too . Try to dey give as little accurate information about yourself as possible when you dey online because online presence get em positive effects, but em dey put us for serious exposure to all forms of cyber attacks.
